ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: (Sorry for not posting. I needed a break from the computer. I’ll be posting regularly from now on, promise.) Tavatron felt as if she was falling. Twisting

(Sorry for not posting. I needed a break from the computer. I�ll be posting 
regularly from now on, promise.)

Tavatron felt as if she was falling. Twisting and turning in a black abyss 
devoid of all light. Encompassed in the darkness, it�s black tendrils snaked 
about her body in an attempt to make her a part of that darkness, devoid of 
light and feeling. There was a time in her life when she would have embraced 
the darkness, a time when nothing else had mattered. But now, now the 
darkness was breached by a pinhole of light. That pinhole grew until it 
drove out the darkness, turning the limitless void into one of green grass 
and massive trees, a realm bordered by reason and emotion.

Tavatron suddenly found herself wandering amidst a forest of redwoods and 
massive oaks. This was new. The light, the grass, the FEELING, this had 
never been a part of her dream before. It was foreign, and frightening. It 
took a great deal to frighten the wolfen warrior, but this dream scared her. 
She was used to the darkness, in essence it had become a part of her, but 
this light, this was different. What could bring about the sudden 
illumination of eternal night? Suddenly Tavatron felt herself being pulled 
away, away from the contentment and relaxation, away from the light. 
Tavatron once more found herself enveloped in darkness, but this was not the 
painless void of her subconscious, this was real.

With much effort Tavatron opened her crimson optics. Small sparks leapt from 
the corners of her eyes. Tavatron bit back against the pain, however this 
very action only caused more sparks to erupt from her battered body. 
Tavatron rubbed her head in an effort to relieve her headache when several 
more blasts drew her attention away from her own injuries to the status of 
her commander. Tavatron growled softly, her optics blurred and 
malfunctioning. She could make out the shape of an immense raptorian 
creature. Either her mind was playing tricks or she was about to die. Either 
way she was in too much pain to care which:

"Beast� mode."

Tavatron had barely spoken when an ear-shattering scream erupted from her 
throat. Her mind was racing as she dug her hind claws into the metallic 
floor. A loud screech echoed off the walls as her claws scratched and tore 
wildly at the floor. Tavatron had attempted to transform, and failed 
miserably. Now she was not only severely damaged, but trapped somewhere 
between robot and beastmode. Sparks flew from every joint as Tavatron cried 
out once again. The pain was intolerable. The sound of grinding gears and 
snapping wires filled her ears as, in a last ditch effort, Tavatron slammed 
her body against the floor, hoping to jar loose whatever it was the was 
preventing her transformation.

With a whine of protest the gears finally complied as Tavatron�s armor 
reorganized itself. She lay there, panting softly, her body occasionally 
sparking. The barrage of fire that had hit her earlier had done more damage 
than she had anticipated. Tavatron�s eyes fluttered open, shutting again 
when she found herself staring directly into an overhead light. Tavatron 
drew her feet under her and slowly stood, her legs surprisingly sturdy 
despite the painful transformation. Tavatron looked up, only to find herself 
staring at the barrel of a gun, and the only thing separating her from the 
owner of the gun some bent bars. Out of the corner of her eye should could 
make out a large figure, too large to be Iron Raptor, but not large enough 
to be her second beastmode. Tavatron took a tentative step toward the 
creature, her eyes still slightly unfocused:

"Iron Raptor?"
